alert.note: Alert for Adams (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 6:22PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN ADAMS COUNTY THROUGH 645 PM EDT... At 621 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Seaman, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Peebles, Winchester, Seaman, Emerald, Cherry Fork, Dunkinsville, May Hill and Serpent Mound. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
